snippet: The gunman also killed himself, the police said. Two of his victims were in a rock band called the Yellow Dogs, made up of other Iranian expatriates.
abstract: Brooklyn police say Iranian gunman Ali Akbar Mohammadi Rafie killed Soroush Farazmand and his brother Arash Farazmand, members of Iranian rock band Yellow Dogs, along with another musician before killing himself; gunman and his victims were all struggling Iranian musician expatriates.

byline.original: By VIVIAN YEE and J. DAVID GOODMAN
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Alain Delaquérière, Matt Flegenheimer, Sarah Maslin Nir and Nate Schweber.

lead_paragraph: The gunman also killed himself, the police said. Two of his victims were in a rock band called the Yellow Dogs, made up of other Iranian expatriates.

headline.main: Bloody End for Iranian Rockers Seeking Musical Freedom in U.S.
headline.print_headline:
Bloody End for Iranian Rockers
Seeking Musical Freedom in U.S.
